perturbation.original_text: 1.6     "CUSTOMER(S)" means one or more customers of the Corio Services having         its principal executive offices in the Territory who obtains a         sublicense from Corio to use the Software or MarketSite.net Service, in         the Corio Market Segment.
perturbation.changed_text: 1.6     "CUSTOMER(S)" means one or more patrons of the Corio Services having         its principal executive offices in the Territory who obtains a         sublicense from Corio to use the Software or MarketSite.net Service, in         the Corio Market Segment.
perturbation.explanation: The term 'customers' is replaced with 'patrons'. The agreement does not define the difference (if any) between a 'customer' and a 'patron', potentially leading to confusion regarding the rights and obligations that apply to each.

perturbation.original_text: 5.3     Support and Maintenance. Commerce One shall provide Corio with support         described in EXHIBIT C hereto, and maintenance in the form of Updates         and Upgrades. Corio shall be responsible for providing its Customers         with routine technical support of the Software and MarketSite.net         Service. Corio shall escalate any technical support questions or         problems it is unable to answer or resolve directly to Commerce One for         Commerce One's immediate attention and resolution under the schedule set         forth in EXHIBIT C hereto. The support described in this Section 5.3 and         EXHIBIT C hereto shall be provided to Corio but Commerce One shall have         no obligation to provide any maintenance or support services to other         third parties. Subject to Corio's payment of the annual support and         maintenance fee, Commerce One's support and maintenance obligation of         the Software and MarketSite.net Service shall continue after termination         or expiration of this Agreement with respect to all Software Users         granted access to the Software and MarketSite.net Service prior to         termination or expiration of this Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text: 5.3     Support and Maintenance. Commerce One shall provide Corio with support         described in EXHIBIT C hereto, and maintenance in the form of Updates         and Upgrades. Corio shall be responsible for providing its Clients with routine technical support of the Software and MarketSite.net         Service. Corio shall escalate any technical support questions or         problems it is unable to answer or resolve directly to Commerce One for         Commerce One's immediate attention and resolution under the schedule set         forth in EXHIBIT C hereto. The support described in this Section 5.3 and         EXHIBIT C hereto shall be provided to Corio but Commerce One shall have         no obligation to provide any maintenance or support services to other         third parties. Subject to Corio's payment of the annual support and         maintenance fee, Commerce One's support and maintenance obligation of         the Software and MarketSite.net Service shall continue after termination         or expiration of this Agreement with respect to all Software Users         granted access to the Software and MarketSite.net Service prior to         termination or expiration of this Agreement.
perturbation.explanation: The word 'customers' is replaced with 'clients', creating ambiguity. The agreement does not define whether 'customers' and 'clients' refer to the same entity, leading to uncertainty in determining which support obligations apply to whom.

perturbation.original_text:
9       LIMITATION OF LIABILITY.

     EXCEPT FOR LIABILITY ARISING UNDER SECTION 8 OF THIS AGREEMENT, IN NO         EVENT SHALL EITHER PARTY'S LIABILITY ARISING OUT OF THIS AGREEMENT OR         THE USE OR PERFORMANCE OF THE SOFTWARE EXCEED THE TOTAL AMOUNT ACTUALLY         PAID BY CORIO HEREUNDER FOR THE TRANSACTION WHICH THE LIABILITY RELATES         TO DURING THE TWELVE (12) MONTHS IMMEDIATELY PRIOR TO THE FILING OF THE         CAUSE OF ACTION TO WHICH THE LIABILITY RELATES. EXCEPT FOR LIABILITY         ARISING UNDER SECTION 8 OF THIS AGREEMENT, IN NO EVENT SHALL EITHER         PARTY HAVE ANY LIABILITY TO THE OTHER PARTY FOR ANY LOST PROFITS OR         COSTS OF PROCUREMENT OF SUBSTITUTE GOODS OR SERVICES, OR FOR ANY         INDIRECT, SPECIAL OR CONSEQUENTIAL DAMAGES HOWEVER CAUSED AND UNDER ANY         THEORY OF LIABILITY AND WHETHER OR NOT SUCH PARTY HAS BEEN ADVISED OF         THE POSSIBILITY OF SUCH DAMAGE. THE PARTIES AGREE THAT THIS SECTION 9         REPRESENTS A REASONABLE ALLOCATION OF RISK.
perturbation.changed_text:
9       LIMITATION OF LIABILITY.

     EXCEPT FOR LIABILITY ARISING UNDER SECTION 8 OF THIS AGREEMENT, IN NO         EVENT SHALL EITHER PARTY'S LIABILITY ARISING OUT OF THIS AGREEMENT OR         THE USE OR PERFORMANCE OF THE SOFTWARE EXCEED THE TOTAL AMOUNT ACTUALLY         PAID BY CORIO HEREUNDER FOR THE TRANSACTION WHICH THE LIABILITY RELATES         TO DURING THE TWELVE (12) MONTHS IMMEDIATELY PRIOR TO THE FILING OF THE         CLAIM TO WHICH THE LIABILITY RELATES. EXCEPT FOR LIABILITY         ARISING UNDER SECTION 8 OF THIS AGREEMENT, IN NO EVENT SHALL EITHER         PARTY HAVE ANY LIABILITY TO THE OTHER PARTY FOR ANY LOST PROFITS OR         COSTS OF PROCUREMENT OF SUBSTITUTE GOODS OR SERVICES, OR FOR ANY         INDIRECT, SPECIAL OR CONSEQUENTIAL DAMAGES HOWEVER CAUSED AND UNDER ANY         THEORY OF LIABILITY AND WHETHER OR NOT SUCH PARTY HAS BEEN ADVISED OF         THE POSSIBILITY OF SUCH DAMAGE. THE PARTIES AGREE THAT THIS SECTION 9         REPRESENTS A REASONABLE ALLOCATION OF RISK.
perturbation.explanation: The term 'cause of action' is replaced with 'claim.' While both relate to legal disputes, their precise legal meanings can differ. The contract doesn't clarify if they're used synonymously, potentially affecting how the liability limitation applies in different situations.
